commented_code:
run: npm run format
 
             # Build the extension before running tests
-            - name: Build Extension
-              run: npm run compile
+            - name: Build Tests and Extension
+              run: npm run pretest

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -70,8 +70,8 @@ jobs:
               run: npm run format
 
             # Build the extension before running tests
-            - name: Build Extension
-              run: npm run compile
+            - name: Build Tests and Extension
+              run: npm run pretest
discussion_comments.comment_body:
`check-types` and `lint` run twice now, but I prefer to keep them because they don't add significant latency while making the intention more explicit.
Considering the test setup will change, I think it makes sense to keep `pretest` instead of running all of the necessary commands here, so we don't need to update the workflow when there are changes to the test build.

commented_code:
+name: Create Linear Issue on Pull Request
+
+on:
+    workflow_dispatch:
+    pull_request:
+        branches: [main]
+        types: [opened]
+
+permissions:
+    pull-requests: write
+
+jobs:
+    create-linear-issue-on-pull-request:
+        runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+        steps:
+            - name: Checkout
+              uses: actions/checkout@v3
+
+            - name: Check for existing Linear link

discussion_comments.comment_body: Could we create an action instead of doing this inline with the job?
